Verity-Belle Atkinson

Soprano Singer | Teacher | Music Practitioner

Verity-Belle is a classically trained soprano, vocal coach, and music practitioner based in the Vale of Glamorgan, performing and teaching throughout South Wales. She graduated from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama with First-Class Honours in her BMus degree and went on to complete her MMus in Music Performance with Distinction, also from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, in 2021.

About

Verity-Belle hails from the charming market town of Cowbridge in South Wales. She received her formal training at the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, earning First Class Honours in BMus Music and later an MMus in Music Performance with Distinction in 2021.

As a Soprano, Verity-Belle has performed in prestigious productions, including Heggie’s Dead Man Walking with the Welsh National Opera Chorus and Janáček’s The Diary of One Who Disappeared alongside Nicky Spence and Simon Lepper. She has also sung at the BBC Proms with the BBC National Chorus of Wales and regularly appears as a soloist with choral societies and male voice choirs across the UK.

Her commitment to musical outreach has led her to collaborate with the BBC, Welsh National Opera, British Arts Council, Oasis Cardiff, and UK-American conferences, creating and recording educational projects and performances.

Verity-Belle also nurtures young musical talent through her work with Stagecoach Performing Arts in Bridgend, Cowbridge, and Cardiff. As Vocal Coach for Stagecoach’s Performance and Show Troupes, she teaches students aged 4-18, many of whom go on to perform on West End stages and at high-profile events. She finds joy in inspiring the next generation of performers and thrives on the energy they bring to every lesson.

Her passion for collaborative music-making extends to her role as a Music Leader with the Forget Me Not Chorus, where she has led sessions in care homes and hospitals since 2020. She currently directs FMNC Newport’s weekly sessions, bringing music and connection to communities through shared musical experiences.

Verity-Belle believes deeply in the transformative power of music. For her, the most rewarding aspect of her work is the human connection created through shared musical journeys—every session is a unique, joyful experience that she feels privileged to call her profession.
